channel.title: My alarm clock
channel.description:
Okay so for christmas I didn't ask for much, and I didn't receive much. A few small gifts here and there. However what I really wanted was an alarm clock so I didn't have to rely on my shitty phones alarm to wake me up. Anyways I got my sister to buy me an alarm clock for christmas, it's quite cheap.
So I set it to the time, and then I wake up in the morning look at my clock and it says its 12 noon. Strange I slept in that early.
I go downstairs and the clock tells me its 11am. Some how my alarm clock went faster...
So now I've reset it 3-4 times to what ever my computers time is, and within a few hours the alarm clock is already 30minute ahead.
HOW HARD IS IT TO FUCKING MAKE AN ALARM CLOCK THAT KEEPS THE TIME?

item.title: My alarm clock
item.dc:creator: @bootnecklad bootnecklad
item.description:
@bootnecklad wrote:

HOW HARD IS IT TO CHECK YOUR BROKEN LINK?

@ David :

[quote=“bootnecklad, post:3, topic:251247”]MOD MOD MOD!!!

Go on… I think you should try it, fire up the soldering iron, learn how to solder , open it up, void any warrenty potentially brake it, but have a good go and learn something. =][/quote]

Read full topic

me, so make it 4.

item.title: My alarm clock
item.dc:creator: @davidude36 Brolapse
item.description:
@davidude36 wrote:

I don’t understand how a company who makes alarm clocks cannot make a clock which keeps the time in order.

Oh well I shall probably take it back to the shop in a few days as we kept the receipt.

item.title: My alarm clock
item.dc:creator: @King_Redrum King Redrum
item.description:
@King_Redrum wrote:

Check and see if it was made in America, if it was, it’s a piece of shit, go buy one that was made in China and it’ll work like a charm.
